trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> class represents the extended protection policy used by the server to validate incoming client connections.

Any classes that expose the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class should not allow the setting of null policies, should supply a default policy, or should require an explicit policy to be created and set by the application developer or administrator.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> class that specifies when the extended protection policy should be enforced.

When this constructor is used to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.PolicyEnforcement%2A> property is set to the `policyEnforcement` parameter and the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.ProtectionScenario%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ProtectionScenario.TransportSelected>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.PolicyEnforcement"></xref> value that indicates when the extended protection policy should be enforced.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> class from a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that contains the required data to populate the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref>.

This constructor implements the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable?displayProperty=fullName> interface for the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class.

The <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.System%23Runtime%23Serialization%23ISerializable%23GetObjectData%2A> method can be used to serialize an <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> object.

This serialized object can then be used with <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.%23ctor%28System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo%2CSystem.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext%29> to construct a new <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> object.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> instance that contains the information that is required to serialize the new <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> instance.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that contains the source of the serialized stream that is associated with the new <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> instance.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> class that specifies when the extended protection policy should be enforced and the channel binding token (CBT) to be used.

When this constructor is used to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.PolicyEnforcement%2A> property is set to the `policyEnforcement` parameter, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.CustomChannelBinding%2A> property is set to the `customChannelBinding` parameter, and the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.ProtectionScenario%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ProtectionScenario.TransportSelected>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.PolicyEnforcement"></xref> value that indicates when the extended protection policy should be enforced.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBinding"></xref> that contains a custom channel binding to use for validation.
policyEnforcement is specified as .
customChannelBinding is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> class that specifies when the extended protection policy should be enforced, the kind of protection enforced by the policy, and a custom Service Provider Name (SPN) list that is used to match against a client's SPN.

When this constructor is used to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.PolicyEnforcement%2A> property is set to the `policyEnforcement` parameter, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.ProtectionScenario%2A> property is set to the `protectionScenario` parameter, and the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.CustomServiceNames%2A> property is set to the `customServiceNames` parameter.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.PolicyEnforcement"></xref> value that indicates when the extended protection policy should be enforced.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ProtectionScenario"></xref> value that indicates the kind of protection enforced by the policy.
A <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> that contains the custom SPN list that is used to match against a client's SPN.
policyEnforcement is specified as .
customServiceNames is `null` or an empty list.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> class that specifies when the extended protection policy should be enforced, the kind of protection enforced by the policy, and a custom Service Provider Name (SPN) list that is used to match against a client's SPN.

When this constructor is used to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> class, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.PolicyEnforcement%2A> property is set to the `policyEnforcement` parameter, the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.ProtectionScenario%2A> property is set to the `protectionScenario` parameter, and the <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.CustomServiceNames%2A> property is set to the `customServiceNames` parameter.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.PolicyEnforcement"></xref> value that indicates when the extended protection policy should be enforced.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ProtectionScenario"></xref> value that indicates the kind of protection enforced by the policy.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ServiceNameCollection"></xref> that contains the custom SPN list that is used to match against a client's SPN.
policyEnforcement is specified as .
customServiceNames is `null` or an empty list.
Gets a custom channel binding token (CBT) to use for validation.
This read-only property represents a custom channel binding token to use for validation.
This is used in advanced scenarios when the CBT is provided by a custom outer channel.
An example scenario might use this property in combination with <xref:System.Net.Security.SslStream> and <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateStream>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ChannelBinding"></xref> that contains a custom channel binding to use for validation.
Gets the custom Service Provider Name (SPN) list used to match against a client's SPN.
This read-only property indicates the custom SPN list that is used to match against a client's SPN.
By default, the server will determine a default SPN list according to its registered endpoints.
For scenarios which require SPN checking, this property can be specified using a using a constructor to override the default list used to match against the clientâ€™s SPN.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ServiceNameCollection"></xref> that contains the custom SPN list that is used to match against a client's SPN.
Indicates whether the operating system supports integrated windows authentication with extended protection.
The changes to support extended protection are currently available for applications on Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2.
The extended protection features will be made available as updates for Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008.
The extended protection features are not available on earlier versions of Windows.
`true` if the operating system supports integrated windows authentication with extended protection, otherwise `false`.
Gets when the extended protection policy should be enforced.
This read-only property indicates when extended protection policy should be enforced (always, when supported by clients, or never).
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.PolicyEnforcement"></xref> value that indicates when the extended protection policy should be enforced.
Gets the kind of protection enforced by the extended protection policy.
This read-only property indicates the kind of protection enforced by the policy.
A <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ProtectionScenario"></xref> value that indicates the kind of protection enforced by the policy.
Gets a string representation for the extended protection policy instance.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> instance that contains the representation of the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> instance.

Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with the required data to serialize an <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.System%23Runtime%23Serialization%23ISerializable%23GetObjectData%2A> method can be used to serialize an <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> object.

This serialized object can then be used with <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy.%23ctor%28System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo%2CSystem.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext%29> to construct a new <xref:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy> object.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that holds the serialized data for an <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref> object.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that contains the destination of the serialized stream that is associated with the new <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ExtendedProtectionPolicy"></xref>.
